intro: Stauntonia crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants like the cashew and poison ivy. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy blooms and attractive foliage. Stauntonia crassifolia prefers warm, humid climates and is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions.
